Class StandardRotationStrategy

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.tetris.model.bricks.StandardRotationStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
RotationStrategy
public class StandardRotationStrategy extends Object implements RotationStrategy
Standard implementation of RotationStrategy with wall-kick support. Attempts to find valid positions by trying horizontal offsets when the initial rotation position is blocked.

Wall-kick offsets tried: -1, +1, -2, +2 from current position.

    • findOffsetForRotation

      public Point findOffsetForRotation(int[][] boardMatrix, int[][] rotatedShape, Point currentOffset)
      Description copied from interface: RotationStrategy
      Finds a valid position for a rotated brick.
      Specified by:
      findOffsetForRotation in interface RotationStrategy
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the current board state for collision detection
      rotatedShape - the shape matrix after rotation
      currentOffset - the current position of the brick
      Returns:
      the adjusted position if valid, null if rotation is blocked

    • optimizePosition

      private Point optimizePosition(int[][] boardMatrix, int[][] rotatedShape, int x, int y)
      After finding a valid position, try to shift the brick to fill gaps and position it optimally (flush against walls when possible). This prevents bricks from "floating" away from walls after rotation. Only applies optimization when near walls on standard-sized boards.
